Package info.kgeorgiy.ja.amirov.implementor

Class Implementor

java.lang.Object
info.kgeorgiy.ja.amirov.implementor.Implementor
All Implemented Interfaces:
Impler, JarImpler
public class Implementor extends Object implements Impler, JarImpler
Implementor provides automatic implementation of interfaces and abstract classes. It can also package the generated implementations into a JAR file.

    • getMethodSet

      private static Set<MethodWrapper> getMethodSet(Class<?> clazz)
      Collects a set of MethodWrapper objects representing all unique methods (considering method name and parameter types) that the specified class or interface needs to implement, directly or indirectly.
      Parameters:
      clazz - The class or interface to analyze.
      Returns:
      A set of MethodWrapper objects representing all methods that need to be implemented.

      private void compile(Class<?> clazz, Path path) throws ImplerException
      Compiles the generated source files for the specified class. This method utilizes the system's Java compiler to compile the source files.
      Parameters:
      clazz - The class whose implementation has been generated.
      path - The path where the source files are located.
      Throws:
      ImplerException - If the compilation fails or a compiler is not available.

    • generateManifest

      private void generateManifest(Class<?> clazz, Path path, Path jarPath) throws ImplerException
      Generates the manifest file for the JAR and writes the implementation class into the JAR file. This method constructs the manifest to include the main class and packages the compiled class files into the JAR.
      Parameters:
      clazz - The class whose implementation is to be packaged.
      path - The directory containing the compiled class files.
      jarPath - The output path for the JAR file.
      Throws:
      ImplerException - If an error occurs during manifest generation or JAR creation.

    • implementJar

      public void implementJar(Class<?> clazz, Path jarFile) throws ImplerException
      Implements the specified class and packages the implementation into a JAR file. This method generates the implementation source code, compiles it, and then packages the compiled class files into a JAR.
      Specified by:
      implementJar in interface JarImpler
      Parameters:
      clazz - The class to be implemented.
      jarFile - The output path for the JAR file.
      Throws:
      ImplerException - If an error occurs during any stage of JAR file creation.

    • main

      public static void main(String[] args)
      The main method serves as the entry point for the Implementor application. It processes command-line arguments to generate implementations for specified classes or interfaces, and optionally packages the compiled files into a JAR.

      Usage:

      • To generate source code: java Implementor <fully-qualified-classname> <output-directory>
      • To generate a JAR file: java -jar Implementor -jar <fully-qualified-classname> <jar-file>

      The application supports two modes of operation based on the input arguments:

      1. Direct implementation generation mode, which requires two arguments: the fully qualified name of the class or interface to implement, and the path to the output directory where the source code will be saved.
      2. JAR generation mode, indicated by the presence of "-jar" as the first argument, followed by the fully qualified name of the class or interface and the path to the output JAR file.
      In both cases, the specified class or interface must not be a primitive type, array, final class, or private inner class.
      Parameters:
      args - The command-line arguments, specifying the operation mode and necessary parameters.

    • implement

      public void implement(Class<?> clazz, Path root) throws ImplerException
      Description copied from interface: Impler
      Produces code implementing class or interface specified by provided token.

      Generated class' name should be the same as the class name of the type token with Impl suffix added. Generated source code should be placed in the correct subdirectory of the specified root directory and have correct file name. For example, the implementation of the interface List should go to $root/java/util/ListImpl.java

      Specified by:
      implement in interface Impler
      Parameters:
      clazz - type token to create implementation for.
      root - root directory.
      Throws:
      ImplerException - when implementation cannot be generated.
